page.title: 08The Village of Lanjeth
page.content: Lanjeth is a small village on the main road between St. Austell and Newquay. It is surrounded by the two main China Clay works in the area namely the ones at Blackpool and Burngullow. There used to be a large pit at Blackpool but now this has closed down. The area around Burngullow contains the most up to date equipment used for drying clay. This decline in the local industry has had its effects upon the village. The Post Office has recently closed down and the Primary School has been turned into a private house. The village still has its own Methodist Church (1867) and a very popular village hall completed in March 1983. There is a wide variety of houses in the village and there are four large farms in the surrounding area. The Lanjeth Riding School is also popular locally. (Mike Yates)
